choices.text: Given a sequence of integers a, satisfying all of the following conditions: - The length of a is N. - Each element in a is an integer between 1 and K, inclusive. - a is a palindrome, that is, reversing the order of elements in a will result in the same sequence as the original. Then, Aoki will perform the following operation an arbitrary number of times: - Move the first element in a to the end of a. How many sequences a can be obtained after this procedure, modulo 10^9+7
